boardgame.name: Victory at Sea: IJN Submarines & MTB sections
boardgame.description:
Submarines: The Kaidai-7-class, or KD-7, was developed in the late 1930s, following on from the preceding KD-6 class. With a surface range of 8,000nm at 16kts, and a submerged endurance of 50nm at 5kts, they possessed a slightly better underwater performance to the late-model KD-6s and better surface speed (though not range) than the earlier members of that class. All members of the class were lost by mid-1944. Another ocean-going submersible using 533mm forward and aft torpedo tubes, it served in the South Pacific as well as the waters off Australia. I-177 sunk the hospital ship AHS Centaur off Stradbroke Island. It was presumed lost with all hands on 18 November 1944, while the I-176 was lost six months earlier off of the Solomon’s. There were 10 KD-7 submarines built overall.

MTBs: Designed as a suicide craft, the Shin’yō either carried a powerful explosive or two depth charges. The depth charges were intended to be planted by the pilot of the boat, after which he would then make his escape. Although nearly 10,000 were built, they accounted for the sinking of only 5 ships, mainly landing craft.

The Imperial Japanese Navy fielded a number of variants on a standard torpedo boat design, differing mainly in machinery fit which affected displacement, giving the illusion of more variety than existed in practice. 238 boats were built within these designations, all armed with two 18-inch torpedoes and 25mm or 13.2mm guns.

Contents:
3 Kaidai-7-class Submarine
2 Shin'yo Kamikaze boat sections
2 T-14 MTB sections
Ship Cards

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Victory at Sea: Battle for the Pacific

boardgame.name: Victory at Sea: US Navy Submarines & MTB sections
boardgame.description:
Submarines: The Gato-class of submarine was the first mass production US submarine class of the Second World War, forming the majority of the United States Navy’s submarine fleet of the war. It was the Gato-class, and the successors of her design that were largely responsible for the disruption of the Japanese merchant fleet. Individual Gato-class vessels were given names of marine creatures, with the lead of her class named for a type of small catshark.

MTBs: The Elco mounted four torpedo tubes which, combined with its speed, made it a serious threat to larger ships. The largest PT boat used by the US Navy, the Elco is also notable for future President Kennedy commanding one. Crews of these boats relied on their smaller size, speed and manoeuvrability – and darkness – to survive.

Contents:
3 Gato-Class Submarines
2 Elco ‘77 PT Boat Sections
2 Elco ‘80 PT Boat Sections
Ship Cards

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Victory at Sea: Battle for the Pacific

boardgame.name: Victory at Sea: Kriegsmarine U-Boats & MTB sections
boardgame.description:
Submarines: A long-ranged submersible, the Type IX was the most successful U-boat of the war, with each vessel averaging over 100,000 tons of shipping sunk. One Type IX, U-107, made the most successful convoy mission of the war, with nearly 100,000 tons of shipping sunk out of Freetown in Africa. The latest variants of this design were capable of ranges of more than 23,000 miles, allowing them to rove far in search of convoys, while their heavy load of torpedoes allowed them to keep pace with a convoy, attacking night after night.

MTBs: The R1-class of R-Boat (from the German Räumboot, meaning minesweeper) was intended to be used as a shallow water minesweeper but, as the war went on, it became a multi-role craft. Its duties expanded to include patrol, antisubmarine, convoy escort, minelaying, and rescue operations. Some classes of R-Boat, such as the R310, were fitted with torpedo tubes, though performance was very modest compared to craft specifically designed for the role.

The ultimate S-Boat to be operational in significant numbers was the S-100-class, which was produced from 1943 and was said to be the best fast patrol boat of its time. The S-100-class was nicknamed the Calotte, as it featured a rounded armoured bridge. It was powered by three Daimler-Benz engines giving it an overall capacity of around 7,500 hp and developing an outstanding top speed of 48 knots.

Contents:
3 Type IX U-Boats
2 S-100 S-Boat Sections
2 R-Boat Sections
Ship Cards

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Victory at Sea: Battle for the Pacific

boardgame.name: Collection
컬렉션
boardgame.description:
Did you know that there are rules about garbage disposal?
Collections are board games that connect natural flows while saving value and money by choosing and giving up opportunities in the process of exchange, collection, sale and resource conversion.

<Purpose of the game>
1. Let's collect recycling, separate collection, and save money.

<Game ready>
1. After shuffling the cards evenly, each player takes 5 cards and 3 tokens.
The remaining cards are placed in a deck in the middle of the table.

When it's your turn, you take 4 actions in turn. The choice of each situation has a great influence on future variables.

<Game play>
1. Card exchange (1 to 2 cards) or separate collection vehicle operation
Choose a player and trade cards. (1 or 2)
If no one wants to exchange, proceed to the next action.
Separate collection vehicles must be operated with the cards they are collecting.
When the car runs, everyone else discards the card from the collected cards.

2. Collection Card Resource Exchange
Cards collected in the previous round can be exchanged for tokens.
(Cards played in this round can be sold after 1 turn.)

3. Card collection (up to 3 types)
You can collect up to 3 types of sorting bins.
What you collect can be sold in the next round.
If you have a disposable recycling bin card, you can collect up to 4 cards.

4. Card replenishment (5 sheets stored)
Fill in the cards used in the deck.
When your turn is over, you must have 5 cards in your hand.

5. If you have executed the actions in order, the turn is passed to the next person.

-When you want to discard a card you are collecting, you pay 2 tokens to the bank for a penalty of unauthorized speculation and discard 1 type of card you choose.
(Cards in your hand cannot be discarded.)

-If you are holding a disposable bin, you can collect additional cards of different types.
After the collection is over, when you sell the cards you are collecting in this bin, you will also discard the disposable recycling bin card.

<Game ends>
1. When someone draws the last card of the deck in the center of the table, the game ends by progressing one by one starting with the next player. Collect all the cards in your hand by type and exchange 3 or more cards for tokens. If you have a garbage truck, you can get 1 token per card. The player with the highest total token score wins.

boardgame.name: Tiny Ninjas: The Void Booster Pack
boardgame.description:
The Void adds 12 new ninja cards to Tiny Ninjas.

Including all new characters: Queen, Skeleton, Mystic, Zombie, Dragon and also introducing YELLOW DAMAGE to the game!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tiny Ninjas Heroes: Dragonfire Expansion
boardgame.description:
(NOTE: THIS IS NOT A STANDALONE PRODUCT. Requires a copy of 'Tiny Ninjas: Heroes' to play).

CONTENTS:
Dragonfire adds 4 HERO Dice, 10 HERO Cards, and 25 ITEM Cards.

New HEROES:
Vampire, Princess, Alien, Dragon

Bonus HERO:
Angry Kitty (Hero Cards only)

New ITEMS:
Golden Shield, Trio's Blades, Angel's Feathers, Grim's Scythe, Gambler's Coin, Pirate's Chest, Medic's Kit, Magician's Hat, Staminana, Grappling Hook, Energy Core, Shadow's Shuriken, Helping Heart, Poison, Fire Scroll, Robot's Robobytes, Brawlcoli, Golden Shuriken

boardgame.name: Soccer Brain
boardgame.description:
Soccer Brain
An outstanding new family game designed to improve a variety of Thinking Skills.
The game begins with a 'cup draw' of eight teams who round by round play the quarter finals, semi-finals and final. With five minutes per half, each player moves across the board, tackling various football-related thinking challenges as they go. There are four kinds of challenge

memory test,
visual perception,
lateral thinking and
Conundrums


If you're lucky, you'll win a penalty and have the chance to 'score from the spot'.
Great fun in a game that really will improve thinking skills!

boardgame.name: Stellar Transformation ④ I Eat Tomatoes - Mortal Realm (Part 1)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the lowest Realm of the multiverse, in a far distant galaxy, there is a mysterious purple planet. On that mysterious purple planet is the Qian Long Continent. On the Qian Long Continent resides billions of people, though the continent itself is large enough to host such a number to the point that it almost appears that human life is scarce. And amongst these billions lies the Qin Clan, an incredibly ancient and profound noble clan.

boardgame.name: Skylanders SuperChargers
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Aw hello Portal Master! Welcome to Skylands: a magical world of wonder and adventure, ruled by the greatest heroic emperor ever known – ME! HAHAHAHAHA! For centuries, meddling do-gooder Portal Masters like you have been sending their miserable Skylanders to stop ME, and hold back the gloriously evil power of The Darkness! But NO MORE! Because now, the Portals are under the complete and utter control of, BUN-BUN-BA, ME, KAOS! And in case you foolish human fools haven’t figured it out yet, I’m the bad guy! HAHAHAHAHA! Glorious, isn’t it? But wait, there’s more. Because I’ve taken the opportunity to capture anyone in Skylands who could’ve even remotely, possibly, helped you. Anyhoo, now that I control the Portals, I am cutting you off from Skylands, FOR GOOD! With no more Skylands to go back to, your Skylanders will simply be the helpless toys I’ve always known them to be. So long, Poser Master, FOREVER! HAHAHAHAHA!


- Kaos taunts the Portal Master

boardgame.name: The Wild Well
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The forest near the small town of Brazier along the road known to the locals as Uther's Trail has long been known as a place of quiet magic. Lately, however, the forest has become dangerously unstable, causing much concern in the town. Signs have been posted along Uther's Trail warning travelers not to venture into the woods, and townsfolk keep their eyes peeled for adventurers willing to travel into the forest and discover the source of the disturbances.

This adventure can be played as a one-shot or over several sessions if desired, and contains eight pages of NPCs, random encounter tables, and wild magic-filled adventure!

boardgame.name: Hideous Daylight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Enter a garden of earthly delights.

The sun has stopped setting over the king's favorite garden. It seemed like a harmless curiosity at first but the animals have turned violent and strange alien beings have appeared. The duke has placed a bounty for enterprising sell-swords to end the curse of endless daylight.

Hideous Daylight is an adventure module for Old-School Essentials and compatible with other pen-and-paper RPGs with old-school sensibilities. Player characters will navigate a 20 point hex crawl to end the strange curse affecting the land.


An adventure for low-level characters.
33 pages of non-linear, character driven adventure in the OSR tradition.
Two keyed dungeons and a 20 point hex-crawl.
A bucolic fantasy setting easily insertable into fantasy RPG campaigns.
Dangerous new monsters, weird magic items, and an unpredictable random encounters table.
Features two gazebos.

boardgame.name: Heist O Tron 3000
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The most important part of a heist is the preparation!

The Heist O Tron 3,000 is a pamphlet designed to help you plan a heist adventure for your favorite fantasy game! You will find tables of targets, traps, guardians, and missions! It is compatible with a series of OSR games such as Old School Essentials, Labyrinth Lord, Knave, Troika!, and more.

User summary:

Hesit O Tron 3,000 is provided as a basic PDF pamphlet and also as front / back (frente / verso) image files in either JPG or PNG format.

boardgame.name: Pelicar: The Gamer's Kit
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Gamer's Kit includes a basic screen with game charts and two dozen pre-printed character sheets.

boardgame.name: Xing
boardgame.description:
Master the laws of nature by controlling the elements! Teleport into the astral dimension and choose to control Huo (fire), Shui (water) or Tu (earth). Use your special powers to atomise or fuse your element and create the perfect sequence of five. The winner restores balance to our chaotic universe. So, Spin away and Wu Xing!

Xing is a game of strategy and balance where players are the masters of a single element. They must use the language of the universe - Math - to tactically position their elements in a sequence and gain victory over others. Spin, pick a card and solve the question to find your position(s) on the board. Place your element token using strategy and planning. Master basic concepts of factors and multiples and gain critical thinking skills in this epic battle of minds!

In Xing, players master the laws of nature by controlling the elements - Huo, Shui and Tu. Each player picks one element and collects 14 tokens of that element. The game board and action spinner are placed in the centre.
Shuffle the fuse and atomise card decks separately and place them beside the game board.
On your turn, spin the action spinner.
If you get Fuse, pick the top card from the fuse deck.
If you get Atomise pick the top card from the atomise deck and,
If you get Pick Any, pick the top card from any deck.
After you pick a card, read what is said and solve it. then choose where you want to place one of your element tokens
For example, if the card reads, ‘multiple of 4 between 35 to 55’, then you can place your token on 36, 40, 44 or 48.

Remember, you can place only one of your element tokens per turn
You must place the element based on the solution of the card you picked.
If the card has more than one solution, pick one of them and place your token there
If a location already has a token then you cannot place another
If you cannot place your token on the game board, you pass your turn

In each deck, there are 2 Wu (the spiral symbol) cards and 2 remove cards. These are special cards.
The Wu card allows you to place one token on the wu symbol on the board. The ‘remove’ card allows you to remove one token of an opponent from the board. when a token is removed it goes back to that player. Once all your element tokens have been used, then you can move them around on the board. just take it from one spot and place it on another, as per the card you pick. Remember, you can place an element token to create your sequence or block an opponent. choose your strategy! The first player to create a line of five of their own element tokens, wins the game. This could be horizontal, vertical or diagonal. Xing can also be played with 6 players split into 3 teams of 2.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Initials Game
boardgame.description:
The Initials Game debuted as a radio game show on KFAN in Minneapolis in May of 2014. It has grown to be a pillar of the Power Trip Morning Show and an addictive juggernaut with our Twin Cities fanbase. Now the excitement and competitiveness of the radio game is available to the masses.

Each game features items that share the same set of initials. The host starts reading clues and contestants race to figure out who or what the host is describing. Item cards can be people, places, things, phrases and more. The winner is the player who collects the most cards out of each set.

The game comes with 420 cards. That's 30 full games of Initials. There are 30 packs, 14 cards in each. There are 12 cards for the game and 2 in case of tiebreakers.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Trail Blazers
boardgame.description:
Pack your bags, get ready… we’re going on an adventure! We’ll travel through the dense jungle of Amazonia, the scorching desert of Tenere, the icy mountains of Makalu and the fiery skies of Shangri La to collect mystical treasures. But beware, perils lie everywhere. Anyone can enter but only a few can escape…

Trailblazers is an exciting memory drawing game that your family will not get enough of. The goal is simple: see a map, spot the treasures and obstacles, remember them and then draw your own way out of it using memory and some basic rules. Then, spin away and maximise your points! Sounds simple but is a laughing riot when opponents take a wrong turn.
Enjoy as your kids use principles of geometry, memory and strategy to draw their way through various adventure worlds. See them master basic concepts of lines and angles, decision making and motor skills right before your eyes!

In Trail Blazers, players travel through four different adventures, collecting coins and avoiding obstacles. The goal is to draw your way out of each maze in the adventure region. Everybody starts with a Path Map, and a sketch pen. Place the adventure book in the centre. Choose an adventure region, and start with Maze 1. Cover the maze with the Spin-A-Round spinner. Keep your sand timer ready.
VIEWING ROUND (30 secs) - When the timer begins, all players must visualise and remember a path in the maze from Start to Finish.
During this time, players are not allowed to draw anything. All pens must be down!
At the end of 30 seconds, the maze is covered again with the Spin-A-Round spinner.
DRAWING ROUND (60 secs) - All players draw their paths on their Path Maps from Start to Finish. They must try to score maximum points by collecting coins and avoiding obstacles. All players must enter with a Ray at the Start point and exit with a Ray at the Finish point. You can enter or exit horizontally or vertically but not diagonally. All paths must be individual line segments, connecting the dots on the path maps from Start to Finish. All paths must be horizontal or vertical and not diagonal. At the end of the drawing round, each player counts their score by placing their path map on the maze in the adventure book. Each coin you collect in your path, you get the points mentioned on it. Each obstacle you hit, you lose points as mentioned on the left hand pages. Add all points for the coins collected, subtract all points for the obstacles hit, add 2 points for entering with a ray at the correct Start point and add 2 points for exiting with a ray at the correct Finish point. This is your score for the drawing round.
SPINNING ROUND - The player with the highest score for this maze, spins the spinner. Now, choose either your entry or exit Ray as the reference Ray. If you get a Parallel, then you count all lines parallel to the reference Ray. If you get a Perpendicular, then you count all lines perpendicular to the reference Ray. Then you multiply the number above by either x1 or x2 as per what they have spun. This is your score for the spinning round.
Add the scores of the Drawing and Spinning round as the final score for maze 1. Repeat the same for Mazes 2 and 3 in the adventure region. The person with the highest total of all three mazes, wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Die Wandernden Wälder - Ewiges Grün
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Das Grüne Meer nennen es manche Einwohner Zhoujiangs, die Wandernden Wälder heißen sie in Dragorea. Die schier endlose Waldregion im Norden Lorakis erstreckt sich über eine Weite, die jedes Reich der bekannten Welt verschlingen würde. Gigantische Bäume, unbekannte Kräuter und sagenhafte Kreaturen warten auf die wenigen wagemutigen Reisenden, die dieses riesige Gebiet erforschen wollen - und doch fast alle scheitern. Denn der Wald hat schon ganze Zivilisationen verschlungen, wie die geheimnisvollen Ruinen tief in seinem Herzen beweisen.

Und er birgt düstere Gefahren und Mysterien. Das Ungetüm des Nordens streift durch die Wandernden Wälder, selbst ein eigener wandernder Wald und mit Schätzen auf seinem bewachsenen Rücken. Pelzjäger erzählen von laufenden Bäumen, dalmarische Expeditionen von Spinnenhorden und uralten Wipfelpfaden. Und wiedergekehrte Schatzjäger berichten von gigantischen Mondsteinschätzen, den Wahnsinn in ihrem Blick.

Die Wandernden Wälder - Ewiges Grün ist eine Erweiterung für das Rollenspiel Splittermond, die sich den legendenumwitterten Wäldern des Nordens widmet. Spieler und Spielleiter finden hier Hintergrundinformationen und viele Spielanregungen zu einer der größten Wildnisse auf ganz Lorakis. Neben diversen Spielinformationen enthält der Band auch mehrere Abenteuersplitter für Expeditionsreisen sowie ein voll ausformuliertes Abenteuer, das die Charaktere in dieses Grüne Meer zieht - auf dass sie dort nicht untergehen.
---
"Die Wandernden Wälder - Ewiges Grün" is an expansion for the role-play game Splittermond, which is dedicated to the legendary forests of the north. Players and gamemasters will find background information and many game ideas about one of the largest wildernesses in all of Lorakis. In addition to various game information, the volume also contains several adventure splinters for expedition trips as well as a fully formulated adventure that draws the characters into this Green Sea - so that they don't sink.

boardgame.name: Zhoujiang: Der Phönix im Schatten des Drachen
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Lang und stolz ist die Geschichte von Zhoujiang, dem Land des Phönix, weit im Osten des Kontinents Lorakis. Seit Jahrhunderten blühen Kunst, Kultur und Wissenschaft in dem prachtvollen Reich am Jadeband, finden wertvolle Waren ihren Weg in weit entfernte Länder, lehren Kampfmeister ihre Kunst an angesehenen Schulen, erkunden Mönche und Gelehrte in abgelegenen Bergklöstern den Willen der Götter und das Wesen der Welt.

Heute jedoch ist ein Schatten über das Land des Phönix gefallen. Der Tod der alten Kaiserin und der Aufstieg des einflussreichen General Wu haben das stolze Kaiserreich gespalten. Die Anhänger der Kaiserfamilie und die Soldaten des Generals liefern sich einen mal offenen, mal verborgenen Schlagabtausch, und im Schatten dieses Kampfes bauen die Triaden, die mächtigen Verbrecherorganisationen Zhoujiangs, ihre Macht immer weiter aus.

Zhoujiang ist ein Quellenband für das Rollenspiel Splittermond, in dem das Kaiserreich am Jadeband beschrieben wird. In diesem Buch erhalten Sie einen tiefen Einblick in die Kultur und Geschichte dieses Landes, in die Mentalität seiner Bewohner, in seine Städte, Siedlungen und Länder. Damit kann der Hintergrund eines Charakters aus Zhoujiang mit weiterer Tiefe versehen werden und das Kaiserreich noch besser als Kulisse für Abenteuer und Kampagnen dienen. Ebenfalls enthalten sind neue Ausbildungen, Meisterschaften, Hintergrundgeheimnisse und zahlreiche weitere Dinge, die dazu einladen, Zhoujiang am Spieltisch mit Leben zu erfüllen.
---
Zhoujiang is a source book for the role-playing game Splittermond, in which the empire at the Jadeband is described. In this book you get a deep insight into the culture and history of this country, the mentality of its inhabitants, its cities, settlements and countries. Thus, the background of a character from Zhoujiang can be provided with further depth and the empire can serve even better as a backdrop for adventures and campaigns. Also included are new training courses, championships, background secrets and many other things that invite you to bring Zhoujiang to life at the gaming table.

boardgame.name: Kuih Muih
boardgame.description:
Kuih Muih is a card game about collecting Malaysian delicacies. It is played over three stages, in which players collect cards to score points. At every stage, cards are divided into stacks. Each round, players take turns to claim a stack, then pick a card from it. Unclaimed cards are returned to the table, with players now knowing the contents of the stack just seen. When a new round starts, player order changes, and players may go for the same stack or try a different stack.

Cards score points in different ways. Usually the more cards of a kind you have the better. Some cards have special powers, e.g. allowing you to swap cards with an opponent.

boardgame.name: Splittermond - Die Götter
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Das Quellenbuch zu Glaube und Priestern in Lorakis

Die Macht der Götter ist in Lorakis allgegenwärtig: Ihre Priester verkünden ihre Lehre und wirken mächtige Magie. Die Pracht der ihnen geweihten Tempel kündet von der ihnen entgegengebrachten Verehrung. Und auch in die Welt der Sterblichen gesandte himmlische Diener kämpfen gegen die Feinde ihrer Herren. Die Götter beeinflussen das Schicksal der Welt durch die in der Kristallchronik gesammelten Orakelsprüche und erscheinen mitunter sogar selbst auf Lorakis, wie etwa in Gestalt der berühmten Gottkaiserin von Kintai.

Im Angesicht dieser überwältigenden Macht stellen sich nicht wenige Sterbliche Fragen: Was ist das Wesen der Götter und was bringt sie dazu, an der Welt der Sterblichen Anteil zu nehmen? Wie können wir ihr Wohlwollen erlangen oder ihrem Zorn entgehen? Und wie kann man ihren wahren Willen ergründen, um ihm gemäß zu handeln? Splittermond: Die Götter gibt Antworten auf diese und noch viele weitere Fragen und vermittelt dabei ein Gefühl dafür, wie Götter in der Welt von Splittermond mit den Bewohnern des Diesseits interagieren und was für eine Bedeutung sie für die Sterblichen haben. Neben Mythen zur Kosmologie und Entstehung der Welt nehmen dabei vor allem Fragen des Glaubens einen zentralen Teil der Spielhilfe ein, sei es die Frage nach den Quellen von Glauben, nach der Struktur von göttlichen Kulten, nach der Ausbildung von Priestern, nach der Bedeutung von Tempeln oder auch nach dem Einfluss des Glaubens auf das Leben gewöhnlicher Bewohner von Lorakis.

Dabei gibt der vorliegende Band keinen erschöpfenden Überblick über die mannigfaltige lorakische Götterwelt, sondern erläutert vielmehr Strukturen, skizziert mögliche Ausprägungen von Kulten und zeigt auf, wie Glaube in Lorakis gelebt wird – alles mit dem Ziel, dass Sie als Spielleiter oder Spieler eines gläubigen oder den Göttern geweihten Abenteurers ihre eigenen Kulte entwerfen und ausgestalten können. Daneben werden aber auch Hilfestellungen gegeben, wie man den Einfluss der Götter in Abenteuer einbauen kann, etwa anhand von Informationen zu göttlichen Dienern oder zum direkten Eingreifen von Göttern.

Abgerundet wird der Band durch weitere Anwendungen bestehender Regeln wie etwa neuen Zaubern, Meisterschaften und Stärken, Angaben zu priesterlichen Optionen der Handwerksregeln, Werten für göttliche Diener, neue priesterliche Ausbildungen sowie Angaben zur näheren Ausgestaltung der Nachteile der Stärke Priester.

Begeben Sie sich mit uns auf die Reise in die Welt des Glaubens und der Götter!
---
The source book on faith and priests in Lorakis

boardgame.name: Fantastic Factories: Promo Pack 2
Fantastiques Fabriques: Pack Promo 2
boardgame.description:
6 exclusive cards for backers of the Fantastic Factories: Manufactions Kickstarter. They can be simply added to the Manufactions expansion.

2 D.R.A.W. Studio cards
2 Wood Workshop cards
2 Mimic cards - helps you out by copying the effect of any contractor in the marketplace

boardgame.name: Fantastic Factories: Faction Pack 1
Fantastiques Fabriques: Pack Factions 1
boardgame.description:
2 Card promo pack that was part of the Fantastic Factories: Manufactions Kickstarter. They can be simply added to the Manufactions expansion.

Metafactory Industries - its power is to copy other faction powers.

BIG Pharma is a corporate faction that really rewards the usage of vitamins in a big way. Instead of changing the value of a die by 1, vitamins can now also change the value of a die by 2! The challenge here is that you don’t start the game with any way to gain vitamins. Luckily you get to see 9 blueprint cards and get 3 vitamins to start the game.

boardgame.name: Esmoda - Die Zitadelle der Unsterblichkeit
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Die Stadt der Untoten, die Zitadelle der Unsterblichkeit, Moloch der Verwesung, Festung der Ewigen, Gefängnis der Verdammten – Esmoda trägt viele Namen und fast alle davon zu Recht: Am Fuße der Schattenwand, am südwestlichen Ende aller Wege des Reiches Zhoujiang, herrschen die Toten. Gezeichnet von ihrer verdammten Existenz, ihr Schicksal auf immer an die Metropole gekettet, streben manche Einwohner nach den Freuden des Lebens. Andere fristen ihr Dasein im endlosen Trott der wiederkehrenden Tage und einige geben sich auf und vergehen in den Schatten des allgegenwärtigen Verfalls.

Doch auch Lebende verirren sich in diese merkwürdige und dunkle Stadt, die uralte Geheimnisse in ihren Mauern versteckt und vom Triumvirat der Tausendjährigen mit eiserner Hand geführt wird: vom Knochenkönig, vom Fleischkönig und vom König der Fliegen. Händler suchen nach seltenen Kunstwerken uralter Meisterhandwerker. Alchemisten kaufen Paraphernalien aus den elenden Minen außerhalb der Stadtmauern. Reiter bringen Botschaften der Elite in die Außenwelt. Und Abenteurer suchen zwischen den verfallenen Gebäuden und den geheimnisvollen Katakomben tief unter den Straßen nach ihrem Glück.

Esmoda – Die Zitadelle der Unsterblichkeit ist eine Erweiterung für das Rollenspiel Splittermond, die sich der geheimnisumwitterten und uralten Metropole Esmoda widmet. Spieler und Spielleiter finden hier Hintergrundinformationen, Abenteueraufhänger und detaillierte Beschreibungen der Mächtigen der Zitadelle, der Ränkespiele im Schatten, der Stadtviertel und der Geheimnisse im Untergrund, um nicht nur die Toten am Spieltisch zum Leben zu erwecken, sondern um die Abenteurer in den Sog dieses Ortes zu ziehen, der gleichzeitig Verheißung und Verdammnis bedeutet. Der Band enthält neben vielen Spielanregungen ein Abenteuer, das die Spielgruppe auf der Suche nach einem Erben tief in die Dunkelheit der Stadt hineinzieht.
---
"Esmoda - Die Zitadelle der Unsterblichkeit" is an expansion for the role-playing game Splinter Moon, dedicated to the mysterious and ancient metropolis of Esmoda. Players and gamemasters will find background information, adventure hooks and detailed descriptions of the mighty of the citadel, the intrigues in the shadows, the districts and the secrets underground, not only to bring the dead back to life at the gaming table, but to draw the adventurers into the maelstrom of this place, which is both promise and damnation at the same time. In addition to many game ideas, the volume contains an adventure that draws the play group deep into the darkness of the city in search of an heir.

boardgame.name: Quest for the Lost Pixel: Catacombs of Atheria
boardgame.description:
In Catacombs of Atheria, the game now throws in a fun press-your-luck mini game known as the Catacombs. You will need to manage your energy to get in and out of there before you pass out and lose what you earned.

The Catacombs is not the only new addition to the game. This expansion also includes more customization for your heroes. Now when your Hero levels up to a certain level, they will have the choice between 2 (Hero specific) additional classes giving them new abilities.

Speaking of Heroes, the expansion also comes with 2 new heroes - The Bard and The Summoner.

Also, new dungeon tiles, events, and artifact cards are added for more things to find, equip, and explore. Why make the Lost Pixel your only quest? Now I have introduced 20 Side Quests to the game. You will be given 3 random Side Quests at the beginning of the game so you can gain more Items and XP as you accomplish each.

Lastly, now each floor of the dungeon comes with 1 Boss Monster. These monsters are devastating, but if you are willing to fight and defeat them, the reward is great!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Quest for the Lost Pixel: Risk and Reward
boardgame.description:
In Risk and Reward, you are given brand new choices to push your luck for great rewards. Everything in this expansion leaves you with difficult choices. Plus this expansion offers a reinforcement set of monsters, treasures, spells, events and more. Lastly, it has a few treasure fixes that replace old cards.

Risk and Rewards offers new Dungeon Areas for your heroes to explore. But why risk the time into exploring these new areas? BRAND NEW SET TREASURES. These get better the more of the same set that you have. Unfortunately, each new area can be very dangerous as well. Also, you will receive PETS that will give you a permanent buff until you decide on discarding your pet for their one time great ability. Lastly, there are 5 new heroes to choose from.

NEW HEROES: Blood Mage, Psionic, Spell Blade, Time Bender, and the Duelist.

Lastly, almost all decks receives tons of new cards from monsters and events to treasures and artifacts. Plus so much more.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rubik's Perplexus Hybrid
boardgame.description: Rubik's Perplexus Hybrid is two puzzles united in a mobile labyrinth: a unique Perplexus coupled with a Rubik's Cube! You have to rotate the faces horizontally and vertically to recreate the path of the labyrinth and move the ball forward in 3D and by rotation. Finishing the labyrinth allows you to finish the Rubik's Cube. In all, it has 100 obstacles to overcome!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Admin: Outside the Scope of BGG

boardgame.name: Grumble-Strike
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is our 10th Monday Mutant of an initial dozen freaks. Included in this PDF is an all-new Reaction Roll table for this unpredictable, role-play heavy new creature. Roll your d100 and add or subtract from previous questions and statements by the Grumble-Strike to find out if it will try and eat your heroes, befriend them, guide them to riches, or betray them. Other tables include a set for the appearance, and gender of this dual-headed thing, as well as a mutation table for the ten percent of these damn things that exhibit deviations.

boardgame.name: Tao Long: The Way of the Dragon – Red Cloth
boardgame.description: This 50x50cm gorgeous red cloth will decorate your table and be the perfect companion of the game.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Tao Long: The Way of the Dragon

listing.notes:
NEW!
+Shipping
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.

boardgame.name: Rolling Ranch: Stamps
boardgame.description:
There is nothing better than roll & stamp. Your ranch will look amazing with these stamp animals.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Rolling Ranch

boardgame.name: Inglenook's Bloodlines of Lesser Fame
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A supplement for Pathfinder 1st edition, offering an assortment of bloodlines that are not as grand or legendary as those in the core rules. 4 new bloodrager bloodlines and 10 for sorcerers, plus three wildblooded options. In addition, 11 new spells dealing specifically with bloodlines, ranging from detecting bloodline-empowered creatures to concealing your own, denying a creature its ancestral gifts, or stealing a creature's bloodline for yourself! The book finishes off with 14 new feats and 6 traits that relate specifically to bloodlines.

Can't find any kings in your lineage? Devoid of draconic descent? Absent abyssal or aberrant affliction? Don't worry! One ancestor is as good as another, and your humble background may still have granted you sorcerous power, though perhaps nothing quite so impressive at parties. Discover the secrets of little-known lineages like the anonymous, carceral, furtive, ocular and torpid bloodlines. Obliterate adversaries with gelatinous might, or reveal to them the true power of having ancestors who were defeated so comprehensively that it passed down through generations.

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Serpent Kings (C&C)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Written by Skerples and adapted to the Castles and Crusades® game by Troll Lord Games.

boardgame.name: Switch
boardgame.description:
The objective is simple: Be the first player to arrange four of your game pieces in a two-by-two square. But winning this clever two-person game requires both a keen memory and cunning strategy.

There are 10 total player pieces: 3 orange, 3 green, and 4 two-color pieces.

Setup:
Turn five of the pieces orange side up and five pieces green side up, which will ensure the right distribution of two-color pieces. Each player then chooses a color and takes their five pieces.

Moves:
Player 1 starts by selecting a piece to play, after looking underneath to check its color, and places the piece anywhere on the board. Player 2 can then decide to PLACE one of their pieces on the board, FLIP any pieces on the board over while keeping it in the same space, or MOVE any piece of their color to a different space (you cannot move a piece that is not your color, only flip it).

Winning:
The game continues while each player tries to wager between placing, flipping, or moving the pieces on the board to create a two-by-two square of their color.

boardgame.name: Under a Funeral Moon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For four to six 1st level characters, written for the Castles and Crusades ® Roleplaying game by Troll Lord Games.

boardgame.name: King Thief Minister: Duel
boardgame.description:
There is a commotion in the royal palace. In the midst of the crowds, the king wants to ascend the throne and establish order. On the other side is the peasant who wants to expose the hand of the king and his agents. Reaching the throne is not that simple as sometimes it is necessary to enter the dressing room and change clothes so as not to be recognized by the opponent.

In King Thief Minister: Duel, the King, the Thief, the Minister, the Sherif, the Executioner, and the Peasant move in the form of cups on a map of the palace and hide from each other. Ultimately, it is the memory contest that determines the winner of the game.

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness – The Shadow World
boardgame.description:
The Heroes of Drunagor struggle mightily against the Darkness to keep the light of hope alive. But beyond the edge of reality there sits another world—one where Darkness has already claimed dominion over all! Dare to bring the light to this Shadow World and face horrifying creatures of pure evil. But beware: for wherever there is light, there are Shadows!

Age of Darkness is a fully-cooperative strategy board game of tactical combat and dungeon-crawl style adventure for one to five players. Explore the world of Drunagor through the game’s immersive 3d environment and illustrated Points of Interest—where your choices determine the route your story will take! You need a copy of the Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness core game to play with this expansion.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Ballad of Heroes
روایت سلحشوران
boardgame.description:
The ballads of heroism are being told.

As narrators of this story in The Ballad of Heroes, we can constantly change the story so that the greatness and glory go to the hero that our tribe wants. In this way, we do not neglect hand-to-hand combat.

boardgame.name: Twilight City: Love as a Cure
boardgame.description:
User Summary

You are a young vampire searching for a cure to their immortality in the city of Skylight.

boardgame.name: The Dark Mansion
boardgame.description:
Ahriman warriors stand in front of an old mansion that has been hidden underground for centuries. According to legend, they know that the mansion is protected by the Ahriman. They enter through the main entrance, but when the last of them has entered, they notice that the trap doors begin to slide shut. A voice in the mansion shouts, "You are buried here forever."

When you find yourself inside The Dark Mansion, a one-vs-all game, you might consider it a grave, but as one of the fighters, you have tools on hand that can help you survive. Can you defeat the devil and get out of the mansion?

boardgame.name: Food Chain Island: Lost Beasts
Isla Animal: Bestias Prehistóricas
boardgame.description: An 6-card expansion of additional extincted animals, that have special eating requirements and no special abilities. You can shuffle these with the animals in the base game.

boardgame.name: Ergastulum: Dungeon Nightmares 3
Ergastulum: Dungeon Nightmares III
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




The game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer and remains in active development. Some information and gameplay elements may change in the future.




Ergastulum is a first-person fantasy horror adventure game that blends a mix of Asian and Western folklore to create a terrifying vision that will test a players faith to the extremes. The game focuses on psychological horror which relies on the character’s fears and abnormal psyche to frighten players.

The game seeks to challenge and confuse the player’s grasp of the narrative by creating doubt about their own perceptions of reality or questioning their own sanity.

An Ergastulum is a building used to hold in chains dangerous slaves, or to punish other slaves. The Ergastulum is subsurface and large enough to allow the slaves to work within it and containing narrow spaces in which they sleep.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: 500 Miles
boardgame.description:
Walk 500 miles without also walking 500 more.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song I'm Gonna Be (500 Miles) by The Proclaimers.


A postcard dexterity game, where players race flickering pennies.

The first player, on their first turn, uses a finger to flick or push their penny so that it touches or crosses the first line - but not the second line. On each player's subsequent turns, the player flicks their penny so that it is closer to the right of the card that the other player's penny but does not completely cross two different lines on the same flick. If unsuccessful, the get one chance to retry.

If a player is unable to successfully complete their turn on a retry, they lose the game. If a player is able to flick their penny past the 500 mark without breaking the other rules for their turn, they win the game.


Released in the May 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: One-Hit Wonder Songs postcards (Button Shy)

boardgame.name: Mouse Cheese Cat Cucumber
boardgame.description:
Prepare yourself for mysteries and maze building in Mouse Cheese Cat Cucumber, a quick, asymmetric, tile-placement and hidden roles game.

Each character in the game wins differently: The mouse is trying to get the cheese, the cat wants the mouse, the cheese wants everyone to get along — they're neutral because they're Swiss — and the cucumber is evil and wants to trap all of the characters together. Though all players have equal control of the clockwork maze, their secret agenda dictates who they are in the conflict and how they win.

On your turn, you pick a room from the conveyor belt to add to the maze. Your placement may cause other rooms to rotate and force characters to move. Outwit your opponents and create your win.

Mouse Cheese Cat Cucumber has four modes of play: multiplayer, two solo versions, and a puzzle that you "win" by assembling everything.

listing.notes: New in shrink. < 0.5 lbs.
Box & Components are in perfect condition; only played once. We'll cover the PayPal Fee and BGG Commission.
Title: Mouse Cheese Cat Cucumber Publisher: Fight in a Box Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Spin Me Right Round!
boardgame.description:
Shake out your arms and get loosened up!

Inspired on the one hit wonder song You Spin Me Round (Like a Record) by Dead Or Alive.


Spin Me Right Round! is a moving and action game played in real time, so be ready!

The DJ will toss the postcard onto the table by spinning it in the air. The action for that round is determined by whichever corner is pointing at the DJ when the postcard stops spinning. Once the DJ calls out the action, all Dancers must perform that action as fast as they can, then slap the postcard.

The first Dancer to slap the postcard will be the DJ for the next round, and the last one is eliminated from the game.

Once down to only 2 players, whoever slaps first, wins!


Released in the April 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: One-Hit Wonder Songs postcards (Button Shy)

boardgame.name: 5 Room Dungeons Zine #1: The Tower of Drowned Shadows
The Tower of Drowned Shadows
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Terror of Darkness

Herein ye shall find the horrors of being trapped in darkness for centuries. Trapped under water for so long it has changed souls forever. Trapped in duties so old, some no longer recall who they are.

For those brave enough to travel deep down into the cold, wet darkness, where shadows flirt with death and spectres of the past seethe with revenge, a great secret awaits.

But is the secret worth dying for?

Only you can answer that question as you run The Tower of Drowned Shadows.


This is a D&D 5E adventure that should make a thrilling night of horrific entertainment.

Players discover a buried tower filled with water and undead.

Both roleplay and combat paths are possible.

The tower also poses a puzzle for cunning players.

This adventure also offers:

New magic item — Frostfinger
New monsters — the Drowned Specter and Drowned Shadow
New NPCs — Rhanes, Captain of the Guard and Slit, Leader of the Assassasin


This challenging adventure is suitable for Tier 1 play. But I've also included detailed instructions on how to level up encounters for CR 4, CR 8, and CR 12 play, including new Legendary actions and Lair Actions.

I've also added Designer Notes to help you have a very successful run.

boardgame.name: Horror in the Windy City
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Horror in the Windy City brings the excitement, intrigue, and beautiful chaos of the time period to your table using the 5e rules you already know as adapted by the acclaimed Whispers in the Dark RPG written and developed by Matt Corley and M.T. Black.

Within this product you’ll find two books: Horror in the Windy City, a full-length RPG campaign sourcebook expanding the Whispers in the Dark RPG universe, and a novella, The Devil’s City, written by Bram Stoker award winner Sara Tantlinger and Matt Corley. Whispers in the Dark is compatible with the 5th edition of the world's oldest rpg and set in a world adjacent to our own. The books can be enjoyed independently, but when conjoined they offer the players, readers, and game masters a truly immersive experience.

The beautifully illustrated 250+ page book is a fully realized campaign sourcebook covering Chicago in the latter half of the 19th century with new rules, backgrounds, a new alignment system, NPCs, scenarios, and more. In short, it’s everything you’ll need to take your party of investigators to Chicago. It will be up to them to find their way out.

HitWC begins with an essay from Dr. Robert Greene detailing POC in the late 19th century. Afterwards it reveals the timeline of events that led from Chicago’s founding through 1899. Next up are the major neighborhoods and locales of the city, and finally the social clubs, secret societies and criminal organizations that call Chicago home. Throughout are dozens of scenario hooks, statblocks, and informative sidebars.

No book on late 19th century Chicago would be complete without including H.H. Holmes and his infamous Murder Hotel. Holmes and his allies are explored in depth; the hotel is fully mapped and described in exquisite detail.

The Devil’s City introduces five unfortunates stalked, captured, and experimented upon by Holmes. In the final section of HitWC your players are able to assume the roles of those folks as they seek escape Holmes and his domain. Each character from The Devil’s City has a full page illustration and a character sheet for the players and GM to begin play with minimal prep time.

boardgame.name: Tetroll
boardgame.description:
A quick Tetris-inspired roll-and-write game.

Try to both score valuable rows and snatch bonuses before your opponent takes them. Plays in about 20 min and is designed for for 1 or 2 players.

On your turn you roll all four dice. The majority of the faces tell you which shape you have to enter into your grid with the values of the rolled dice. You score points for completed rows and for completing bonus tasks.

boardgame.name: MAGUS NOVATUS
boardgame.description:
Once a year, the renowned Ludikah School of Witchcraft choose a student to turn them into a great wizard. The apprentice that displays their magical skills will be the chosen one!
Cast spells by mixing potions correctly and by using some magical items. Be careful! Some spells may have unexpected effects and they may bring chaos among the novice wizards.
MAGUS NOVATUS is a family game with the perfect combination of decision, chance and interaction. It guarantees a great fun to all players in their role of novice wizards.

The goal in MAGUS NOVATUS is to be the player with the most point at the end of the game. In order to do so, players will try to get as many Spell cards as possible, which will grant 2, 3 or 4 points depending on their difficulty.

The components the boardgame are cards, dice and Measuring Cylinder marker.

MAGUS NOVATUS is a boardgame for 2-4 players, 30 minutes and +8 years old.

Una vez al año, la prestigiosa escuela de magia Ludikah elige a un alumno para convertirlo en un gran mago. Aquel aprendiz que demuestre sus dotes mágicas será el elegido.
Realiza hechizos combinando las pociones de forma correcta y haciendo uso de algunos objetos mágicos. ¡Pero cuidado! Algunos hechizos pueden tener efectos inesperados y desencadenar el caos entre los magos novatos.

Magus Novatus es un juego para toda la familia con la mezcla perfecta de decisión, azar e interacción que asegurará una gran diversión a los jugadores en su papel de magos novatos.
El objetivo en MAGUS NOVATUS es ser el jugador con más puntos al final de la partida. Para ello, los jugadores intentarán conseguir todas las cartas de hechizo posibles, las cuales otorgarán 2, 3 o 4 puntos según su dificultad.

El juego está compuesto por cartas, un dado y una probeta para marcador de duración de la partida.

MAGUS NOVATUS es un juego para 2-4 jugadores, de 30 minutos de duración y para jugadores a partir de 8 años de edad.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: The Festering Fields
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ghelspad is a massive and diverse land. Once a paradise, this continent is now scarred by the ravages of the Titanswar. In the wake of divine bloodshed, and beset on all sides by titanspawn, the people of Ghelspad survive and thrive on this befouled continent. Vigil Watch explores six different locations across Ghelspad.

From the bloody shores of the Toe Islands in the east to the Sweltering Plains of the west, Vigil Watch provides an in-depth look at a variety of locales and cultures.

Vigil Watch Part Five details the Festering Fields, a wasteland corrupted by undeath and one of the most dangerous regions in the Scarred Lands!.

boardgame.name: Leyendas de la Marca del Este
boardgame.description:
Leyendas de la Marca del Este es tu pasaporte a un mundo ahíto de aventuras, monstruos y tesoros.

Leyendas de la Marca del Este es un juego de rol completo, con un sistema de juego a caballo entre los retroclones antiguos y los juegos modernos de exploración de mazmorras, simplificando las mecánicas de estos últimos para una experiencia de juego muy satisfactoria mientras se conservan los tropos característicos de la vieja escuela... con un toque renovado.

Leyendas de la Marca del Este es compatible con todo el material publicado hasta la fecha para el clásico Aventuras en la Marca del Este e incluye notas de conversión para pasar de un sistema a otro.
boardgame.rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este

boardgame.name: Harrowing Haynight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This adventure is best played with a group of 1-5 characters of level 2-3.

A local farmer named Harold Haynight lives with his family on a farm a few miles south east of here. He has reported an unknown mischievous presence at night, which has been vandalizing his farm. What started with defacing his scarecrows, has now become something that makes him fear for his family. Your job, should you choose to accept it, will be to investigate the disturbance and either deal with the perpetrators, or escort the Haynights to the safety of civilization.

boardgame.name: The Pike Pole
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Nautical Themed Weapon Compatible With The World's Greatest RPG!

Supplement Contains:

Basic info & lore on the traditional use of pike poles as tools
Backstory reasons for being proficient
Explanation of the 2 special actions this weapon allows, Knock Prone & Disarm
Weapon cards for several Pike Poles of different rarities -with artwork for each


Unique weapons are just more fun, whether your a player looking to change it up, or a GM looking to trip up your players, put the pike pole in your game today!

boardgame.name: Beyond the Dungeon (Issue #2 - Fall 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome space explorers to the latest edition of Beyond the Dungeon. In this issue we explore the final frontier: space!

You'll find these articles:

Traits to play aliens and spaceship crews
New rules for space ships, and high-tech equipment
Hazards of deep space
Tips for running your first game of Abstract Dungeon
Theta Quadrant – A high-adventure space exploration mini-setting
Mizar System – A gritty space mini-setting
A Rude Awakening – An space adventure introducing the Mizar System setting
Random Adventures – Table to create random planets and gigs for freelance crews


So set a course for adventure and engage your hyperspace drive!

boardgame.name: Los Piratas de Rhoimor
The Rhoimor Pirates
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A band of elusive pirates is terrorizing the area of lake Rhoimor, authorities of the City of Skyrock are perplexed by the ability of these rufians to "disappear" after commiting their crimes and have called for help from mercenaries and aventurers alike, in hopes of stopping these malcontents and bring peace to the region once again.


Una banda de elusivos piratas está aterrorizando el área del lago Rhoimor, las autoridades de la ciudad de Roca del Cielo están perplejas por la capacidad de estos rufianes para "desaparecer" después de haber cometido sus crímenes y ahora buscan la ayuda de mercenarios y aventureros por igual, con la esperanza de detener a estos maleantes y traer de nuevo paz a la región.

boardgame.name: La Hija del Posadero
The Inkeeper's Daughter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A nest of Chrymusks, nasty crab-like creatures that dwell in damp environments, has made their home in a section of the Theras city sewers. Recently these cretures have invaded the basement of the Gleaming Brigandine Inn and attacked the Inkeeper's infant daughter. Something has to be done about these "unwanted visitors" and the inkeeper is willing to offer a reward to people anyone brave enough to venture into the city sewers to exterminate these pests.


Un nido de Chrymusks, desagradables criaturas crustáceas que viven en ambientes húmedos, ha hecho de las cloacas de la ciudad de Theras su hogar. Reciéntemente estas criaturas invadieron el sótano de la posada de la brigantina resplandesciente y atacaron a la pequña hija del posadero. Alguién debe hacer algo al respecto de estos "visitantes indeseados" y el posadero está dispuesto a ofrecer una recompensa a cualquier persona suficientemente valiente como para aventurarse en las cloacas para exterminar a estas criaturas.

boardgame.name: Reavers of Midgard: Mara Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
A set of 3 Promotional cards offered by the "Man Vs Meeple Season 3 Kickstarter".

Mara is a Sea Witch that can be battled in the Sea Battles section of the board.

boardgame.name: The Dwarven Auction
La Subasta Enana
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An exclusive group of dwarven collectors known as the Siverstone Association is hosting an auction of magical weapons that once belonged to mythic heroes. Fearful that more than one person might try to steal or even destroy some of the items in their fine selection during the event, they are offering a hefty sum as payment for anyone capable bolstering their security team.


Un exclusivo grupo de coleccionistas enanos conocidos como la Asociación Silverstone, está promoviendo una subasta de armas mágicas que alguna vez pertenecieron a heroes míticos. Temerosos de que alguién pudiera intentar robar e incluso destruír algunos de los artículos de la colección durante el evento, se ofrece una suma importante a quiénes sean capaces de apoyar con las labores de seguridad.

boardgame.name: Salvando a Hargú
Saving Hargu
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's just a routine find and capture mission for the PC's, or so it seems... The PC's patron is losing his profitable alchemy business to a black market merchant who is selling counterfeit ingredients for a lower price. The PC's are tasked with capturing and bringing the merchant to justice when a group of cloacked warlocks unexpectedly abducts a half-orc baby from the arms of her mother. Would the PC's risk losing their contract to help a mother in distress? or would they put a baby's life at risk to fulfill their task?


Es olo una misión de busqueda y captura para los PJ's, o por lo menos eso parece... El cliente de los PJ's está perdiendo su redituable negocio de alquimia debido a un comerciante del mercado negro que está contrabandeando igredientes a un menor precio. Los PJ's deben encontrar al comerciante y entregarlo a la justicia cuando un grupo de brujos encapuchados secuestran a una bebé semi-orco arrancándola de los brazos de su madre. ¿Estarán los PJ's dispuestos a parder su contrato para ayudar a la madre? ¿O pondrán la vida del bebé en riesgo para cumplic con la tarea que tenían asignada?

boardgame.name: El Barril sin Fondo
The Bottomless Barrel
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Drow sorcerer has been placing curses on small towns of the region, something has to be done. Or, has it been done yet? if so, then why are you celebrating in a tavern? now that you mention it, who serves the drinks?. Something seems odd in this tavern...


Un hechicero Drow ha estado imponiendo maldiciones en pueblos pequeños de la región y algo debe hacerse al respecto. O, ¿ya se hizo? si es así, ¿por qué estaís celebrando en esta taverna?. Ahora que lo mencionaís, ¿quién sirve los tragos?. Algo no está bien en este lugar...

boardgame.name: Gritos Desde el Sótano
Screams From the Basement
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mysterious disappearances during the night keep a small town on the brink of collapse, townsfolk reports hearing screams coming from the inside of an abandoned building but no one dares to investigate. When rumors of an adventuring party arrived at the tavern the inhabitants flock to it like flies, desperately asking for help. ¿What would the reply be?.


Extrañas desapariciones durante la noche tienen a un pequeño pueblo al borde del colapso, los habitantes han reportado escuchar gritos provenientes de un edificio abandonado pero nadie se atreve a investigar. Cuando se ecuchan los rumores que un grupo de aventureros ha llegdo a la taberna local los habitantes se agolpan hacía ella como moscas pidiendo ayuda desesperadamente ¿Cuál será la respuesta?.

boardgame.name: The Graveyard Shift
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A lone undertaker has been finding dug-up graves inside the St. Belran's cemetery grounds. At first he suspected graverobbers, but then noticed the missing limbs... He now suspects something more "sinister" roams the cemetery at night and is up to the players to find out what.

boardgame.name: The Ranvesjorl Butcher
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A series of grisly murders have been taking place at the small, quiet village of Ranvesjorl. Townsfolk are growing increasingly scared and angry because of the mayor's apparent inactivity. Is the killer a man? or a beast?. And more importantly, who is going to stop it from claiming another victim?

boardgame.name: Flip the Birdie
boardgame.description:
Flip the Birdie! Anywhere and everywhere!

Keep Birdie off the ground and catch those Stars before they blow up!

Unlock loads of new characters with your Stars to Flip the Bird whatever and whenever you want.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Jack-o'-lantern
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Jack-o'-lantern creature feature is a holiday special module for the Legends System tabletop roleplaying game ruleset that can be effortlessly inserted into any of its worlds of legend. Of course, you can also choose to adapt the creature stats for its use with any other existing campaign setting or game system you already use.

boardgame.name: The Bear King's Wife
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four characters of level 15

The redoubtable Sir Locryn Ashby is missing. So are the rest of his hunting party.
They were due to arrive back at Merriweather Lodge three days ago, there to enjoy a hero’s feast and (according to the gnomish nobleman’s itinerary) regale all and sundry with tales of daring exploits in the deep wood. It seems that the deep wood had other plans.

Now Ashby’s remaining retainers are making noises about a rescue mission, hinting that any heroes willing to make the trek to their master’s basecamp could expect a worthy reward.

boardgame.name: Spooky Synthfire Stories
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An exciting new 5E universe from Lasers & Liches that resides in a place of half faded memories, barely remembered songs, lost childhood friends, outdated styles, abandoned dreams, lost playthings, vapor ware, and time corroded nostalgia. A place both strange and familiar. A place for adventure, friendship, chaos, and the magic of yesteryear. In short, a place that combines your love of the present with your adoration of the past.

Three unknown creatures in the deep forest gather around a campfire to tell you tales of strange and scary monsters within the Retroverse. They speak of new playable subspecies, horrific new monsters, and even share a few of their artifacts with you. All they want in return, is a few scary stories from you...

boardgame.name: Exoto-Park Escape
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dinosaurs have escaped! While this is a somewhat common occurrence, this time is a little different. Fragmented copies of the dinosaurs have appeared in multiple realities, requiring Ka-OS (the employee responsible for the whole mess) to beseech different heroes from multiple realities to help them return to dinosaur or end their life link to the portals.

This is a small adventure designed to be run as a series of sessions or as a side adventure that can be easily added easily added to any ongoing campaigns.

boardgame.name: Incarnation
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the PCs accept a job transporting an attorney to a meeting with a local noble, an approaching radioactive dust storm is the least of the dangers they face. Their destination, an opulent but neglected mansion presided over by a reclusive Countess and her loyal servant, holds within madness, torture, and deadly secrets kept for decades. Prevented from leaving by the raging radstorm, the heroes may find that all their skills and experience might be useless against a weapon even they weren’t prepared for.

Incarnation is a short adventure for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG.)

boardgame.name: QuaranZine (No. 1 - Apr 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Remember the good old days, when roleplaying games were in person, dice rolls were physical, and the finale of every dungeon wasn't a teleconference bug? Those days aren't back, but Quaranzine is here to help. This volume is meant for those judges, scattered across the planes, whose noble spirits have been tested by their social distancing, and are ready to game for a great cause: COVID-19 victim relief.

Produced by community volunteers and charged with fulsome amounts of Dungeon Crawl Classics-compatible content, this zine brings you a bevy of unique entities, spells, monsters, and tables for use with your DCC games.

You’re no shut-in.

You’re an adventurer. . .
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: The Dryad King: A Mad, Bark-Laden Patron God
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: The Invisible Hand: Lawful Deity of Wealth, Utility, and Rational Self Interest
Parchment Poiesis: A Wizard's Spell for DCC RPG
The Penitence Shroud: A Magical Item for DCC RPG

boardgame.name: QuaranZine (Vol. 2 - Oct 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Remember the good old days, when roleplaying games were in person, dice rolls were physical, and the finale of every dungeon wasn’t a teleconference bug? Those days aren’t back, but QuaranZine is here to help. This volume is meant for those judges, scattered across the planes, whose noble spirits have been tested by their social distancing, and are ready to game for a great cause: COVID-19 victim relief.

Produced by community volunteers and charged with a fulsome amount of Dungeon Crawl Classics-compatible content, this zine brings you four new funnels to use in your DCC games. All proceeds from QuaranZine volume 2 will be donated directly to a non-profit COVID-19 relief fund.

That’s right – while you and your players repel insectoid aliens, battle kaiju, save children from witches, or destroy an infernal ooze machine, your money will be going to help families impacted by COVID-19 across the United States.

You’re no shut-in.
You’re an adventurer…
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Zombiefilled The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Zombiefilled The Card Game is a casual game of chance and strategy that can be played by everyone, 8 years old and above. This is great for family bonding or any kind of gathering. Be prepared to have fun!

There are 4 types in the game - Heroes, Zombies, Items, and Action Cards. You win by being the only survivor or by successfully using the Exit! Action Card.

Zombiefilled is a series of card and board games, with Zombiefilled The Card Game serving as its base game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Horror at the Harvest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The small hamlet of Shadn Valley is holding their annual Pumpkin Festival in conjunction with the year’s harvest. The festival centers on an old fable which the town’s elders speak of. The story tells of a demonic creature who wears a pumpkin for its head. The creature would come out each night during the autumn months and kidnap any child who was disobedient to their parents.

You’ve come to the town as a tourist to experience the fabled Pumpkin Festival for yourself. You are looking forward to enjoying yourself, eating good food until you can’t move, and maybe getting silly drunk on Pumpkin Ale.

However, little do you know, your visit might prove more eventful . . . and horrific . . . than you expect.

Horror at the Harvest is an adventure module for the Micro Chapbook Roleplaying game system set in the mountain village of Shadn Valley in the region of Hellick Water. It is the second volume in the Bone Lord Chronicles story arc. Thus, this adventure may be played on its own or as a part of the larger campaign series of books. This Special Halloween Edition Deluxe Adventure Module includes:

a full festival to explore
festival games to play
new autumn-themed items and treat
autumn-themed magic
rules for lycanthropy
multiple dungeons

boardgame.name: One Night In Dead West
boardgame.description:
Oliva and her husband Paul are visiting a newly acquired mine late one day when they are attacked by a deranged man who is slobbering and incoherent. Paul is killed in the ensuing fight. Oliva escapes to a nearby Saloon. There she runs into a group of people who have no idea what’s going on, except that they heard the dead have risen and are attacking the living. However, a telegram arrived earlier in the day saying a posse is on the way to help rescue survivors but the bad news they won't arrive till morning as they are going town to town to find survivors. All they have to do is survive the night!
It won’t be easy as this is the One Night in Dead West...

You and a group of survivors are held up at a Saloon. The zombies will spawn at the tip of each hour on the game track at random locations determined by 6x D10s. If the zombies are already on the map before spawning new ones, you would check if they break any Barricades, enter the saloon, Move, or attack any players.

Then all the player characters will take their turns in any order they want. They can take a 30-minute action or an hour as long as they haven't taken a 30-minute action already during that hour. Once they are they decide which duration they want to take they move their player pawn on the time track and can only take another 30 minutes or another turn once all the players passed or are on the same space as their pawn.

During a turn, they can choose Rest, Barricade, search for items (if available), or fight zombies. Fighting and barricading costs energy while resting and search requires the player to draw events.

If you survive till 8 am the next day the Posse arrives to whip out the remaining zombies and you must figure out if they mistaken you for a zombie or not based on how many hit points you have left and roll of a D16.

Alternatively, you can win by finding the key to the bar with the wagon and successfully remove the nitroglycerine from it or it could be game over early.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Avventure nel Vecchio Mondo: Il Cavaliere Infernale di Hallt
Hell Rides to Hallt
Piekło jedzie do Hallt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Only the damned and damnable fools ride out on Hexensnacht, as the turning of the year wakes the very dead, calling them up from unmarked graves and unhallowed resting places. The priests of Morr alone are safe, their lonely vigil a solitary ward against the restless dead. So which are you to set out so close to Hexensnacht: fool, damned soul, or lonesome priest? Rumour spreads throughout the land that a headless rider is claiming grim trophies, if it is indeed merely a rumour.

Hell Rides to Hallt is an adventure that explores justice, vengeance, and the twisting of old stories and older faiths. On the road to Hallt, with Hexensnacht perilously close and Morrslieb hanging gibbous in an ominous sky, a coach clatters through the night. Inside, a city-soft lawyer scoffs at tales of a headless horseman scouring the lands, taking heads and leaving widows in his wake. Outside, the heavy beat of galloping hooves draws close.

This adventure is suitable for 3-5 players on their first or second Careers, and is suitable for playing in a single, blood-soaked night. It takes place in Hallt, an isolated town nestled between the Grey Mountains and the Reikwald, but could take place anywhere in the Empire.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Avventure nel Vecchio Mondo: Il Cavaliere Infernale di Hallt - Italian PDF Edition

boardgame.name: Forces of History
boardgame.description:
Forces of History is a game that simulates world history, using an original combination of game mechanics inspired by games as diverse as Terraforming Mars, Twilight Struggle, Innovation, and Reiner Knizia's The Confrontation. Instead of controlling a particular historical leader or empire, players take on the roles of celestial beings who are pulling the strings of history from behind the curtains. The celestials must help each other to make the divine plan for the world unfold, but beneath the thin veneer of cooperation there is fierce rivalry... for the Lord of Time, as ancient as creation itself, will give a rich reward to the celestial who shows the most skill at influencing world events. This is why all actions in the game - recruiting agents, collecting coins, claiming forces, playing cards and more - are ultimately aimed at just one thing: to gain as many Influence Points (IP) as possible. At the end of the game, the player with the most IP wins.

Forces of History is a complex strategy game that combines the best of several different worlds. It simulates world history, yet every playthrough is different from the one before; it offers rich historical lore to the hobby-historian, but you don't need to know or care about history to play it.

The game offers several different game variants: Classical-Medieval Age game (standard), Classical Age game, Medieval Age game, and team play (2v2) in any of the above settings. The playing time can vary from 2 hours up to 6-7 hours, depending on the variant chosen (and on player familiarity). NOTE: The Modern Age is not yet available, but if the game is released and becomes as successful as we hope, it will be released in the upcoming expansion.

This is a game that doesn't easily fit into any established category.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tropical Trouble
boardgame.description:
From back of the box:

A romantic interlude turns into a dangerous chase! Can clumsy Clarence rescue his darling Doris from the big bad Beach Bruiser? Help Clarence avoid rolling coconuts and other obstacles. Don't get clobbered by the monkey or burned by hot lava! You'll lose a chance to rescue dear Doris!

Chase the Bruiser clear across the island. Wind your way around clams, vicious ferns, and sand snakes! Keep running, jumping and dodging! Pick up one of Doris' hankies to become invincible! Only you can help Clarence throw the Bruiser off the bridge and get his little love back!

boardgame.name: Timeline: España
boardgame.description:
Could you play table football before the inauguration of the first railway line in Spain? And read Platero and I at that time? And see Picasso's Guernica? To win the game, be the first to place all your cards correctly. Combine the cards in this game with other Timeline games to make the game more fun and challenging.

—description from the publisher (translated)

¿Podías jugar al futbolín antes de la inauguración de la primera línea de ferrocarril en España? ¿Y leer Platero y yo por entonces? ¿Y ver el Guernica de Picasso? Para ganar la partida, sé el primero en colocar correctamente todas tus cartas. Combina las cartas de este juego con otros juegos de Timeline para que la partida sea más divertida y desafiante.

—description from the publisher
